policies.name: Media Protection Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing protection, storage, access, marking, transport, sanitization, and disposal of system media containing CUI
policies.rationale: NIST 03.08.01 requires 'physically control and securely store system media' which necessitates high-level policy guidance for all media protection activities across the MP family

policies.name: Physical Security Policy
policies.description: Policy defining controlled areas, physical access controls, and secure storage requirements
policies.rationale: Control requires secure storage in controlled areas with physical protections; discussion mentions 'locked drawer, desk, or cabinet or a controlled media library'

procedures.name: Media Storage Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for securely storing digital and non-digital media containing CUI, including storage location criteria, access controls, and environmental protections
procedures.rationale: Control requires physical control and secure storage implementation with specific storage methods

procedures.name: Media Inventory Procedure
procedures.description: Process for conducting periodic inventories of all system media, documenting media location, custodian, and CUI classification
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion states 'physically controlling stored media includes conducting inventories' as a key requirement

procedures.name: Media Library Check-Out/Check-In Procedure
procedures.description: Process for authorized personnel to check out media from controlled storage, document usage, and return media with accountability tracking
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion requires 'establishing procedures to allow individuals to check out and return media to libraries, and maintaining accountability for stored media'

executionEvidence.name: Monthly Media Inventory Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports documenting: complete list of system media containing CUI, physical location, assigned custodian, CUI classification, last inventory date, discrepancies identified and resolved, inventory completion signature
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires conducting inventories as part of physical control; monthly frequency aligns with CIS controls for asset inventory; 45-day threshold allows one missed cycle before escalation

executionEvidence.name: Media Check-Out/Check-In Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: media identifier, person checking out, date/time out, date/time returned, purpose of use, authorizing signature, media condition upon return
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion requires procedures for check-out/return and maintaining accountability; logs provide audit trail of media custody

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Physical Storage Inspection Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports documenting: inspection of all media storage locations, verification of locked storage, environmental condition checks, access control verification, unauthorized media identified, remediation actions taken
executionEvidence.rationale: Ensures ongoing compliance with secure storage requirements; quarterly aligns with typical security assessment cycles

executionEvidence.name: Current Media Custodian Assignment List
executionEvidence.description: List showing: each media item or category, assigned custodian with contact information, date of assignment, supervisor approval, last review date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires maintaining accountability for stored media; current custodian assignments enable accountability tracking

physicalEvidence.name: Controlled Storage Area Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Documentation showing: location of controlled storage areas, physical access controls (locks, badges), environmental controls, list of authorized personnel with physical access
physicalEvidence.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'physically control' and 'secure storage includes a locked drawer, desk, or cabinet or a controlled media library' - physical evidence validates implementation

physicalEvidence.name: Storage Facility Photos or Diagrams
physicalEvidence.description: Photos or diagrams showing: locked storage cabinets/drawers, media library layout, access control mechanisms, environmental monitoring equipment if applicable
physicalEvidence.rationale: Visual documentation validates that secure storage meets NIST requirements for physical controls in controlled areas

operationalActivities: Conduct monthly physical inventory of all system media containing CUI
Maintain media library with check-out/check-in procedures and logs
Store all system media containing CUI in locked storage within controlled areas
Update media custodian assignments when personnel changes occur
Inspect storage facilities quarterly for security compliance
Document and investigate any media discrepancies found during inventory
Restrict physical access to media storage areas to authorized personnel only

policies.name: Media Protection Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing protection, storage, access, marking, transport, sanitization, and disposal of system media containing CUI
policies.rationale: NIST 03.08.02 requires restricting access to CUI on system media, which is a core media protection policy requirement

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: Policy defining authorization processes, role-based access controls, and access restriction mechanisms
policies.rationale: Control requires restricting media access to authorized personnel/roles, which aligns with broader access control policy requirements

procedures.name: Media Access Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Process for determining which personnel or roles are authorized to access specific types of system media containing CUI, including authorization criteria and approval workflow
procedures.rationale: Control requires restricting access to 'authorized personnel or roles' - formal procedure needed to establish and maintain authorizations

procedures.name: Media Access Control Implementation Procedure
procedures.description: Technical and physical procedures for restricting media access, including check-out processes, physical locks, cryptographic controls for digital media, and access logging
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion describes both physical controls (inventories, check-out procedures) and cryptographic controls for digital media

procedures.name: Media Access Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic review of authorized media access lists, validation of continued need for access, and removal of unnecessary authorizations
procedures.rationale: Control requires ongoing restriction enforcement; periodic reviews ensure access remains appropriate over time

executionEvidence.name: Current Authorized Media Access List
executionEvidence.description: List documenting: personnel/roles authorized to access each media type, justification for access, approving authority, date authorized, last review date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires restricting access to authorized personnel/roles; current list validates who has authorization and why

executionEvidence.name: Media Access Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: user identity, media identifier accessed, date/time of access, access method (physical check-out or digital access), purpose if documented, duration of access
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion requires maintaining accountability for media; access logs provide evidence that only authorized personnel accessed media

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Media Access Authorization Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: all current authorizations reviewed, inappropriate access removed, justification revalidated, inactive users identified and removed, reviewer signatures and dates
executionEvidence.rationale: Ensures continued appropriateness of access restrictions; quarterly aligns with access review best practices from CIS controls

executionEvidence.name: Media Encryption Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: For digital media: reports showing media items containing CUI are encrypted, encryption algorithms used, key management procedures followed, encryption status verification date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion states 'for digital media, access to CUI can be restricted by using cryptographic means' - verification ensures cryptographic access controls are in place

physicalEvidence.name: Physical Media Access Control Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Documentation of physical controls restricting media access: locked storage mechanisms, media library access controls, physical access logs to storage areas
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion emphasizes 'physically controlling such media' including check-out procedures and accountability - physical controls are a primary access restriction method

operationalActivities: Maintain current list of authorized personnel/roles for each media type
Implement physical access controls (locks, controlled areas) for media storage
Implement cryptographic controls for digital media containing CUI
Log all media access events (check-outs, digital access)
Review and update media access authorizations quarterly
Remove media access when personnel change roles or leave organization
Verify encryption of digital media containing CUI quarterly
Investigate and document any unauthorized media access attempts

policies.name: Media Protection Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing protection, storage, access, marking, transport, sanitization, and disposal of system media containing CUI
policies.rationale: NIST 03.08.03 requires sanitization prior to disposal/reuse, which is a fundamental media protection policy requirement

policies.name: Media Sanitization and Disposal Policy
policies.description: Policy defining sanitization requirements, approved techniques by media type, disposal procedures, and NARA policy compliance for CUI
policies.rationale: Control requires sanitization 'prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse' - dedicated policy needed to address NIST SP 800-88 and NARA requirements

procedures.name: Media Sanitization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for sanitizing different media types (digital and non-digital) using approved techniques: cryptographic erasure, clearing, purging, physical destruction - aligned with NIST SP 800-88
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion lists specific sanitization techniques and references SP 800-88 as the authoritative guide for media sanitization procedures

procedures.name: Media Disposal Procedure
procedures.description: Process for disposing of sanitized media, including disposal authorization, tracking, certificate of destruction requirements, and NARA policy compliance verification
procedures.rationale: Control requires sanitization 'prior to disposal' - formal procedure ensures proper sanitization before final disposal

procedures.name: Media Reuse Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Process for authorizing media reuse after sanitization, including sanitization verification, reuse authorization approval, and CUI classification assessment
procedures.rationale: Control requires sanitization 'prior to release for reuse' - procedure ensures proper sanitization before repurposing media

procedures.name: Embedded Media Sanitization Procedure
procedures.description: Specific procedures for sanitizing media embedded in devices: printers, copiers, scanners, mobile devices, network components before disposal or reuse
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly includes 'digital media in scanners, copiers, printers, notebook computers, mobile devices, workstations, network components' - these require specialized procedures

executionEvidence.name: Media Sanitization Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs documenting: media identifier/description, CUI content classification, sanitization method used (clear/purge/destroy), date of sanitization, personnel performing sanitization, verification method, disposal or reuse destination
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: N/A - maintained as permanent audit trail
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires sanitization before disposal/reuse; detailed logs prove compliance with NIST SP 800-88 sanitization requirements

executionEvidence.name: Certificates of Destruction
executionEvidence.description: Certificates from destruction vendors showing: media description, serial numbers if applicable, destruction method, date destroyed, witness signatures, vendor certification number
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion notes NARA policies 'may require destruction when other methods cannot be applied' - certificates prove proper destruction occurred

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Sanitization Procedure Compliance Audits
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: sample of sanitization logs reviewed, verification of proper technique selection by media type, NIST SP 800-88 compliance validated, embedded media sanitization verified, non-compliances identified and corrected
executionEvidence.rationale: Ensures ongoing compliance with sanitization procedures across diverse media types; quarterly frequency prevents compliance drift

executionEvidence.name: Annual Review of Approved Sanitization Techniques
executionEvidence.description: Report documenting: review of current sanitization methods against NIST SP 800-88 updates, new media types assessed, technique effectiveness validated, procedure updates implemented
executionEvidence.rationale: Technology and sanitization methods evolve; annual review ensures techniques remain effective per NIST SP 800-88 and NARA policy

executionEvidence.name: Media Sanitization Verification Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: for each sanitization event, verification testing performed (data recovery attempts for critical media), verification results, verification date, verification personnel
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST states 'sanitization process removes CUI from media such that information cannot be retrieved or reconstructed' - verification proves effectiveness

physicalEvidence.name: Sanitization Equipment and Service Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Documentation of approved sanitization equipment (degaussers, shredders, wiping tools) including specifications, maintenance records, and vendor contracts for destruction services
physicalEvidence.rationale: Control requires using 'approved equipment, techniques, and procedures' - physical sanitization equipment documentation validates capability to perform required sanitization

operationalActivities: Sanitize all system media containing CUI before disposal using NIST SP 800-88 methods
Sanitize all system media containing CUI before release for reuse
Sanitize media in devices (printers, copiers, scanners, mobile devices) before disposal/transfer
Select sanitization technique appropriate to media type and CUI sensitivity
Document all sanitization activities in detailed logs
Obtain certificates of destruction for physically destroyed media
Verify sanitization effectiveness for high-value or high-sensitivity media
Review and update sanitization procedures annually to align with NIST SP 800-88
Use approved vendors for media destruction services with proper certifications
Audit sanitization procedure compliance quarterly

policies.name: Media Protection Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing protection, storage, access, marking, transport, sanitization, and disposal of system media containing CUI
policies.rationale: NIST 03.08.04 requires marking system media containing CUI, which is a core media protection requirement

policies.name: CUI Marking Policy
policies.description: Policy defining CUI marking requirements, distribution limitations, handling caveats, and marking standards in compliance with NARA CUI regulations (32 CFR Part 2002)
policies.rationale: NIST discussion states 'CUI is defined by NARA along with marking, safeguarding, and dissemination requirements' - dedicated policy ensures NARA compliance

procedures.name: Media Marking Standards Procedure
procedures.description: Procedure defining specific marking requirements for different media types (digital and non-digital), marking templates, CUI category markings, distribution limitation statements, and handling caveats per NARA standards
procedures.rationale: Control requires marking to 'indicate distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable CUI markings' - standardized procedure ensures consistent NARA-compliant marking

procedures.name: Media Labeling Procedure
procedures.description: Process for applying human-readable markings to physical media (labels, stamps) and implementing security attributes in digital media metadata/filenames
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion distinguishes marking (human-readable) from labeling (internal system attributes) - procedure addresses both aspects

procedures.name: Media Marking Verification Procedure
procedures.description: Process for inspecting media to verify proper markings before release, transport, or storage, including verification checklist and corrective action steps
procedures.rationale: Ensures all media containing CUI has appropriate markings as required by control before leaving controlled environments

executionEvidence.name: Media Marking Standards Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: approved marking templates for each media type, CUI category marking formats, distribution limitation statements, handling caveat options, NARA 32 CFR 2002 alignment verification
executionEvidence.frequency: Maintained and updated as NARA requirements change
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires specific markings per NARA definitions; documented standards ensure consistent, compliant marking across organization

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Media Marking Compliance Audits
executionEvidence.description: Reports documenting: random sample of media inspected (digital and non-digital), proper CUI markings verified, distribution limitations validated, handling caveats checked, unmarked or improperly marked media identified, corrective actions taken, auditor signature
executionEvidence.rationale: Validates ongoing compliance with marking requirements; quarterly frequency ensures marking discipline is maintained

executionEvidence.name: Media Marking Training Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: personnel trained on CUI marking requirements, training date, topics covered (NARA standards, marking templates, handling caveats), training completion certificate, refresher training schedule
executionEvidence.rationale: Proper marking requires personnel understanding of NARA requirements and organizational standards; training records prove capability

executionEvidence.name: Physical Media Marking Photos/Samples
executionEvidence.description: Photo documentation or physical samples showing: examples of properly marked media (labels on USBs, CDs, hard drives, paper documents), demonstrating correct placement and format of CUI markings
executionEvidence.rationale: Visual examples validate implementation of marking standards and serve as training/reference materials

executionEvidence.name: Digital Media Marking Implementation Evidence
executionEvidence.description: Screenshots or exports showing: CUI markings in file metadata, marked filenames following naming conventions, system-generated markings on documents, watermarks or headers/footers on digital documents
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion covers both digital and non-digital media; evidence shows digital marking implementation

operationalActivities: Mark all system media containing CUI with appropriate NARA-compliant markings
Apply distribution limitation statements to media per CUI category
Include handling caveats on media as required by CUI designation
Use approved marking templates and labels for physical media
Implement metadata markings for digital media
Verify proper markings before media leaves controlled areas
Conduct quarterly audits of media marking compliance
Train personnel on CUI marking requirements annually
Maintain current marking standards aligned with NARA 32 CFR 2002
Correct improperly marked or unmarked media when identified

policies.name: Media Protection Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing protection, storage, access, marking, transport, sanitization, and disposal of system media containing CUI
policies.rationale: NIST 03.08.05 requires protecting and controlling media during transport, which is a fundamental media protection policy requirement

policies.name: Media Transport Security Policy
policies.description: Policy defining requirements for transporting CUI media outside controlled areas, including protection methods, authorized personnel, accountability requirements, and documentation standards
policies.rationale: Control requires protecting, controlling, maintaining accountability, and documenting media transport - comprehensive policy addresses all aspects

procedures.name: Media Transport Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Process for authorizing media transport outside controlled areas, including transport request, management approval, authorized courier selection, and risk assessment
procedures.rationale: Control requires restricting transport activities to authorized personnel; formal authorization ensures proper oversight

procedures.name: Media Transport Packaging and Protection Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for securely packaging media for transport using cryptography (encrypted media) and/or physical protections (locked containers), per media sensitivity
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion states 'media protection during transport can include cryptography and/or locked containers' - procedure implements both protection methods

procedures.name: Chain of Custody Procedure
procedures.description: Process for documenting media custody throughout transport: initial release, intermediate transfers, final receipt, including chain of custody forms, signatures, and timestamps
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'maintain accountability' and 'document activities' - chain of custody provides complete accountability trail

procedures.name: Media Transport Tracking Procedure
procedures.description: Process for tracking media during transport through documentation, courier tracking systems, and receipt confirmation to detect loss, destruction, or tampering
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion requires 'tracking or obtaining records of transport activities as media move through transportation system to prevent and detect loss, destruction, or tampering'

executionEvidence.name: Authorized Transport Personnel List
executionEvidence.description: List documenting: names of authorized internal personnel and approved external couriers, authorization date, approving authority, background check status, training completion, last review date
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion requires 'restricting transport activities to authorized personnel' - current list validates who is authorized; 180-day threshold accommodates semi-annual reviews

executionEvidence.name: Chain of Custody Forms
executionEvidence.description: Forms documenting: media identifier/description, origin and destination, releasing personnel signature and date, receiving personnel signature and date, all intermediate transfers, transport method, package seal numbers, condition upon receipt
executionEvidence.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'maintain accountability' and 'document activities' - chain of custody forms are the primary accountability mechanism

executionEvidence.name: Media Transport Logs
executionEvidence.description: Comprehensive logs showing: transport request date, authorized transport personnel, media description and classification, origin/destination, transport method, protection measures used (encryption, locked container), tracking number, delivery confirmation date
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires documenting all transport activities; comprehensive log provides complete transport history for audit purposes

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Transport Security Audits
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: sample of transport records reviewed, chain of custody completeness verified, authorized personnel validated, protection measures confirmed appropriate, tracking records reviewed, non-compliances identified and corrected
executionEvidence.rationale: Ensures ongoing compliance with transport security requirements; quarterly frequency catches procedure violations before they become systemic

executionEvidence.name: External Courier Service Agreements
executionEvidence.description: Contracts or agreements with external couriers showing: security requirements, personnel screening requirements, insurance coverage, CUI handling procedures, incident reporting requirements, agreement effective dates
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion notes 'authorized transport and courier personnel may include individuals external to organization' - agreements ensure external couriers meet security requirements

executionEvidence.name: Media Transport Incident Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports documenting: any loss, destruction, tampering, or security incidents during transport, incident details, investigation findings, corrective actions, notification to affected parties, date resolved
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion requires tracking 'to prevent and detect loss, destruction, or tampering' - incident reports document detection and response

physicalEvidence.name: Transport Security Equipment Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Documentation of approved transport containers: specifications of locked containers, tamper-evident seals, GPS tracking devices if used, equipment maintenance records
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion specifies 'locked containers' as protection method - physical equipment documentation validates capability to properly protect media during transport

operationalActivities: Authorize all media transport outside controlled areas before release
Encrypt digital media or use locked containers for physical media during transport
Restrict transport activities to authorized personnel only
Complete chain of custody forms for all media transports
Log all media transport events with full details
Track media during transport using courier tracking systems
Verify media condition and completeness upon receipt
Maintain list of authorized transport personnel (internal and external)
Review and approve external courier service providers
Investigate and document any transport security incidents
Audit transport security compliance quarterly
Update transport procedures as related controls (03.13.08, 03.13.11) are implemented
